title: Language-Integrated Pedagogical Design for Elementary Mathematics Learning Media Development Using Video: Enhancing Linguistic Expression of Geometric Measurement Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic computation skills, understanding of geometric concepts, foundational vocabulary in mathematical terminology (area, volume, units), and ability to comprehend simple mathematical word problems
context.additional_context: Prioritize developing video-based learning media implementable in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, with specialization in subtitles (e.g., "step-by-step formula explanations"), audio descriptions (e.g., "terminology pronunciation and concept explanations"), and interactive designs (e.g., "terminology quizzes") to strengthen linguistic expression of mathematical concepts. Particular emphasis on systematizing linguistic representations of core concepts such as "nets" and "unit conversions."

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of calculating surface areas of rectangular prisms, cubes, prisms, and pyramids using mathematical terms (e.g., "net," "unit area") and linguistic expressions (e.g., "multiply the base area by the height") with instructional videos.

Learners can reproduce step-by-step problem-solving processes through video tutorials using visual and linguistic expressions (e.g., "describing formula application," "explaining unit conversion") and systematically articulate core concepts (e.g., "surface area components").

Learners can establish a self-directed learning plan (30 minutes/day, 5 days/week) on a mobile learning platform, achieve over 80% adherence for 4 weeks, and write reflective entries in a learning journal using mathematical terms (e.g., "unit conversion," "formula derivation") and concepts (e.g., "principles of surface area composition").

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
